    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void convertPowerupTest()
      testing if has been assigned the correct amount of ammo during the conversion from powerup value
      void dealDamageTest()
      this test verifies if I set the correct amount of damage and the correct state in the receiver of the attack attributes.
      void drawPowerupTest()
      verifies that the player has a new powerup.
      void grabTest()
      verifies if the player receive the correct amount of ammo and verifies if he can get the powerup.
      void grabWeaponAndReplaceTest()
      this test is similar to the previous one, it verifies also that the selected weapon from the player has been changed with the selected weapon in the cell (and also verifies that the first one as been recharged) There's also a commented print in the code of the method grabWeaponAndReplace to verify if the message gets the correct parameters
      void grabWeaponTest()
      verifies if the player has been moved to correct cell, then verifies if he has the correct weapon (and also if the weapon is correctly assigned to him) and then verifies that the weapon has been removed from the cell.
      void markTest()
      verifies if the marks as been added correctly to te player receiver.
      void moveTest()
      verifies if the player has been moved in the selected cell.
      void payAmmoTest()
      verifies if it has been removed the correct amount of ammos during the payment
      void payAmmoWithPowerupsTest()
      verifies if we have removed the correct amount of ammos and the powerup selected to pay
      void reloadTest()
      this test verifies the weapon has been reloaded correctly.

        public void grabWeaponTest()
        verifies if the player has been moved to correct cell, then verifies if he has the correct weapon (and also if the weapon is correctly assigned to him) and then verifies that the weapon has been removed from the cell. There's also a commented print in the code of the method grabWeapon to verify if the message gets the correct parameters

      • grabWeaponAndReplaceTest

        public void grabWeaponAndReplaceTest()
        this test is similar to the previous one, it verifies also that the selected weapon from the player has been changed with the selected weapon in the cell (and also verifies that the first one as been recharged) There's also a commented print in the code of the method grabWeaponAndReplace to verify if the message gets the correct parameters
